Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
8/24/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(a) All of the following personal information pertaining to the
youth: (xii) A photograph updated on an annual basis.
One of four independent living files did not have an updated photo. The last photo on
file was from 4/20/20.
R 400.12422 Foster care record
(3) The record shall contain all of the following information:
(g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of three foster care files did not have an update photo. The last photo on file
was from 7/20/20.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
This facility is non-contracted and therefore not required to follow MISEP.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that

This facility is non-contracted and therefore not required to follow MDHHS contract.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The agency was advised to track foster parent first aid training by the
expiration date of the training, rather than checking the date at
renewal/annual review, as the training may expire between reviews.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
4

There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The CAP, approved on 12/22/20, was the
result of the 12/8/20 interim review. The agency was cited for seven licensing rule
violations. Their CAP implementation over the past year appears to be successful as
the agency only had two violations during the current review; neither of these were
repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 8/9/21 was reviewed. The assessment
addressed prior violations of late action summaries, missing dental exams, missing
treatment plan signatures, and late reports. The CA cited staff turnover and work
changes due to COVID, as one of the main challenges over the past year. However,
the agency addressed these issues with increased training and support, using
tracking systems, supervisory reviews of upcoming deadlines, utilizing monthly
management report data, and monthly quality team meetings to review barriers and
create solutions. These actions appear to be benefiting the agency as there were no
repeat violations found during this review. The CA is confident that additional
improvements can be further made once the program is fully staffed.
Interviews
Interviews were completed with three staff on-site. Staff reported their program has
been very busy, but they overall feel supported by their supervisors and program
manager. Staff did not have any concerns about the program.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
